III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Staff qualifications; volunteer, contractors on central registry
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206
Section • (2) A staff member must be of responsible character and
Description suitable and able to meet the needs of children and families
served by the agency.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Worker held youth's arm too hard.
Investigation
Interviews:
I interviewed Complainant 1 by telephone on 3/28/2024 and
again on 4/2/2024 with MDHHS Worker. Complainant 1 stated
Youth B alleged Staff 1 grabbed Youth A around the arm/elbow so
hard that it left a bruise on the arm of Youth A. Complainant 1
stated the alleged incident occurred the previous day and
Complainant 1 did not observe a bruise on Youth A following the
allegation by Youth B.
I interviewed Youth B by telephone on 3/28/2024. Youth B
reported Youth A had mistakenly been put on the bus following
school so Staff 1 and Youth B had to go to their mother's house to
get Youth A when Youth A got off the bus. Youth B described
Youth A as getting off the bus and going towards the house, but
Staff 1 grabbed Youth A and took Youth A back to the car. Youth
B described Youth A as upset and having a sore arm from Staff 1
grabbing Youth A.
Youth A was interviewed virtually at school on 3/28/2024 with
MDHHS Worker. Youth A stated he got on the bus by mistake and
when Youth A got off the bus Staff 1 grabbed Youth A and took
Youth A to the car. Youth A did not say he was hurt, and Youth A
said Youth B told Youth A that Staff 1 had grabbed Youth A's arm.
Youth A showed his arm, and no bruise was observed.
Staff 1 was interviewed by telephone with MDHHS Worker on
3/28/2024. Staff 1 stated Youth A got on the bus by mistake so
Staff 1 and Youth B went to where Youth A was dropped off to
pick Youth A up. Staff 1 said it was raining and Youth A was
upset/crying and confused when Youth A got off the bus because
Youth A didn't know what was going on. Staff 1 stated she tried to
comfort Youth A by giving Youth A a side hug. Staff 1 denied
2

grabbing Youth A's arm. Staff 1 stated a friend of Youth A's mom
was on the porch, but they didn't interact before leaving with Youth
A. Staff 1 stated Youth A never complained about his arm hurting.
Staff 1 stated they got something to eat from McDonalds after
picking up Youth A. Staff 1 stated she contacted the caseworker
for Youth A and Youth B to let them know what happened
because Staff 1 thought the family of Youth A and Youth B was
upset. Staff 1 described her role as working to find/approve
possible relative placements for Youth A and Youth B. Staff 1
stated she thought Youth B and the family were upset with Staff 1
because the process of approving an appropriate placement was
not immediate and required some time.
Foster Parent 1 was interviewed by telephone with MDHHS
Worker on 4/2/2024. Foster Parent 1 reported Youth A and Youth
B were placed with a relative on 3/30/2024. Foster Parent 1
described Youth B as very protective of Youth A. Foster Parent 1
denied seeing any bruises on Youth A or Youth A complaining that
his arm hurt. Foster Parent 1 stated she did not think there was
anything to the allegations and Youth B coached Youth A. Foster
Parent 1 described Youth A as happy when he came home the
day of the alleged incident.
Documents Reviewed:
Program Manager 1 provided policy information on 4/9/2024 that
indicated the type of physical contact Staff 1 had in comforting
Youth A was acceptable and not a violation of the agency's
policies/procedures.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as interviews and documents
reviewed indicate Staff 1 had physical contact with Youth A
however it was not inappropriate as there is no policy staff
prohibiting staff from side hugs or securing a youth’s arm.
Additionally, Youth A denied any pain and there were no marks
observed on Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
3

Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
